column5: Headed down early to see if the salmon would cooperate.  We got a few, but only after we found the baitfish  Saw a nice mass on the Lowrance and as soon as we went over it, whamo, fish on.  Nice 34 incher.      Forgot to mark the spot on the GPS so we trolled around the general area until we found them again, then marked it.  Sure enough, not long after, I had a real fight on my hands.  This one came in at 37 inches.  I didn't weigh it just in case it was a good entry in the Salmon Derby, which, of course, I neglected to get an entry for again this year  Man was it heavy tho.    We tooled around the general area again going over the baitfish a few more times, but the bite seemed to have turned off.  We decided to head back in after a few hours and Paul pulled up the first cannon ball set up, then the second, then the Dipsy, and just as he went to grab the last line, the Spin Doctor, the rod goes off     Reeled in this nice one to finish off the day.  Another 34 incher.  The blood is a combination of the fish's and Paul's     Got the hook in the finger, ouch.     Took a few shots with the new camera just to test it out of the ducks waiting for the launch to clear.      Decided to stop at JB's to see what was new and when we arrived, he had taken off for a Timmie's (for him and the neighbour store lady who advised us he'd be back in 5 minutes).  So I played with the camera again, trying to get a pic of a plane coming in for a landing overhead.      Our major purchase there was the new folding Musky net.  Nice and easy to stow    Cheers,  Joey
Great report J.Nice photos.   As for this one,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,     Red Greens bro?????????????? LOL

Good fish ...good wildlife...good times...  the last salmon in the pics is very stout....but i think the second one is the winner for the day ...im guessing 19 pounds?   Coats and sweaters in July....who would have ever thought ..  Nice shootin
Great stuff Hun ! Glad to see you enjoying the new boat. And the net... funny how the progression goes. Same one I bought after that Frabil Cradle... lol
Yes, funny eh.  The Frabil Cradle will be in the want ads shortly
Congrats to you and Paul on a great day.  You'll really like that Stowmaster.  I've got one as well.
really clean looking fish........ what size boat are you two fishing out of? tambo
It is a 19.5 footer Tambo

Ah nice report there Joey looks like you and Paul did very well in a short period of time. Oh I really love the new boat what a sweet ride.  Hard to believe we have to dress this warm in July but it is what it is.  I will be down to Burlington on the 1,2,3rd for some more salmon fun.
Nice looking fish    I know it's been said but I have to agree.....coats in July is just wrong.   Hope you get to slime the new net soon and that Paul's finger is ok
Great report and pics Joey Just make sure you get an entry for the derby next time.... it sure was a biggun Leechman
Great report Joey. You and Paul did well. You're getting pretty fancy with that new camera too!
Thanks for the report Joey. Looks like a great day. Nice photo's too, 'cept for that guy with the facial hair!
Nice looking fish Joey  what was the water temp out there?  Rob
Great report, pics, and fish Joey!!!... you and Paul did good!!!  That coat looks warm!
Well done, young Lass!!!  I've seen a few of your reports and it looks like you're havin' a great year Joey  Cheers,  S.
Thanks for the replies everyone, it was a nice, albeit cold day out there  The water temp was 50 deg Rob, colder than the last time we went in June
Joey-just curious what you paid for the net. I bought mine there too but was not entirely satisfied with what I paid for it. Cats Meow for muskie nets tho' .
Solid fishing!
Nice fish and report Joey! I hope from the photo of Paul, that they at least brought him a Timmies! LOL Does not look like the man likes to wait around!
It looks like life is treating you guys very well. I enjoyed the report and the photos Joey. Keep them coming.
Talk about launch etiquette; even the ducks wait their turn. (sorry couldnâ€™t resist) Great report and pictures.  Dan.
